title: Emotional Dysregulation in Adolescents and Adults Decision Tree

NODE_A.question: Is the emotional dysregulation related to a recent traumatic experience or unresolved past shock?

NODE_A1.description: Yes -- Shock, loss or acute destabilization context

NODE_A1A.question: Emotional state marked by stunned reaction, confusion, and anticipatory fear?

LEAF_A1A1.description: Recent emotional shock (e.g., traumatic phone call, fear of motherhood)

recommendation.script: SCRIPT_A: Healing from Shock and Preparing for Inner Peace

NODE_A1B.question: Physiological anxiety with traumatic origin (e.g., pregnancy trauma, medical sentence)?

LEAF_A1B1.description: PTSD + somatic panic response (e.g., fear of dying, tingling)

NODE_A2.description: No -- The dysregulation is more linked to daily stressors or family interactions

NODE_A2A.question: Is the person an adolescent with frustration and anger issues?

LEAF_A2A1.description: Adolescent reacting strongly to interruption or sibling rivalry

recommendation.script: SCRIPT_C: When the world cuts me off, I remain whole

NODE_A2B.question: Adult with unresolved conflict between desire and duty, blocked choices?

recommendation.script: SCRIPT_D: I Become the Author of My Choices Again

NODE_A2C.question: Adult with emotional somatization and health anxiety?

NODE_A2D.description: No -- Symptoms not covered above (refer to complementary themes: #burnout, #grief, #dissociation)
